Class ShoppingBag

  • java.lang.Object
    • ShoppingBag

  • public class ShoppingBag
extends java.lang.Object
    The ShoppingBag class is the container class that represents a shopping bag as an array of items. Property of ShoppingBag is size. Methods associated with ShoppingBag are getGroceryItemList, getSize, find, grow, add, remove, salesTax, salesPrice, printItems (described above each respective method)
    Author:
    Joshua Atienza, Kyle Lee

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private GroceryItem[] bag 
      private int size 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ShoppingBag()
      Creates a ShoppingBag with null array of size 5.

    • Method Summary

      Adds specified GroceryItem to bag.

      Calculates the sum of the prices in the bag.

    • Field Detail

      • bag

        private GroceryItem[] bag

      • size

        private int size

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShoppingBag

        public ShoppingBag()
        Creates a ShoppingBag with null array of size 5.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(GroceryItem item)
        Adds specified GroceryItem to bag. GroceryItem is added in the next immediately available index within the array, and size field increases by 1.
        Parameters:
        item - The GroceryItem being added to the bag

      • find

        private int find(GroceryItem item)
        Finds a specific item in the bag and returns its index in the array. Performs a linear search for the target item.
        Parameters:
        item - The GroceryItem being searched for
        Returns:
        i The index of the found item, -1 if item does not exist in the bag

      • getGroceryItemList

        public GroceryItem[] getGroceryItemList()
        Gets the array of GroceryItem objects associated with the ShoppingBag.
        Returns:
        bag The array-based implementation of the bag

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Gets the size of the ShoppingBag.
        Returns:
        size The number of items currently in the ShoppingBag

      • grow

        private void grow()
        Grows the capacity of the bag by copying over object references from old array to new array. Capacity of the bag increases by 5 when grow() is called.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints string representation of each item in the bag. Adjusts grammar of printed statement according to number of items in bag.

      • remove

        public boolean remove(GroceryItem item)
        Removes specified GroceryItem from bag. Replaces the removing element with the last element, and size field decreases by 1.
        Parameters:
        item - The GroceryItem being removed from the bag
        Returns:
        true if GroceryItem successfully removed, false if GroceryItem not found found or bag empty

      • salesPrice

        public double salesPrice()
        Calculates the sum of the prices in the bag.
        Returns:
        salesTotal The sum of the prices of each item in the bag

      • salesTax

        public double salesTax()
        Calculates the sales tax total of the taxable items in the bag.
        Returns:
        totalTax The sales tax total of only the taxable items in the bag
